results.title: California fire disaster 1970
results.brief_description: Fire service experts discuss the causes, problems and results of the extensive fires occurring in California in 1970. In news documentary format they cover various aspects of preventing and fighting large scale fires. In news documentary format.

results.title: C31: Season 50 presentation
results.brief_description: A montage of clips from the history of C 31 - Melbourne’s community TV station. Established in 1994, C31 gained a full license in 2002 and now attracts over 1 million viewers every month. This montage was produced to celebrate the 50th 13 season broadcast and presents some of the breadth and diversity of C31 programming, as well as a potted history of the station and its achicevements over the last 12 years.

results.title: C News focus: Monday 22 May 2006
results.brief_description: Private lives of public figures. Aired 22 May 2006 this episode focuses on the media, and their coverage of the private lives of public figures. Independent MP Andrew Olexander is interviewed on what it feels like to be the subject of such scrutiny.

results.title: By nature's rules
results.creator_credit: Jim Lawless and Jim Lawless Motion Picture Consultants
results.brief_description: A doctor describes the condition of hypothermia, or exposure sickness, detailing its gradual effect on the mind and body. This slow numbing process of physical and mental faculties is then shown in a dramatic enactment of the experiences of a group of hikers who vary in stamina and in their knowledge of the dangers of inadequate protection against changes in weather. When one experienced climber recognizes the symptoms of hypothermia and takes positive action the symptoms and treatment of this insidious malady are clearly demonstrated.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jim Lawless and Jim Lawless Motion Picture Consultants
